page.title: 16LANDSCAPE
page.content: THIS IS A VERY HILLY AREA WITH THE ONLY FLAT LAND BEING ON RAISED BEACHES ALONG THE SOUTH BANK OF THE RIVER CLYDE. THE GOUROCK END IS VERY HILLY AND MOST OF THE SLOPES ARE NOW BUILT ON,ALTHOUGH SOME REMAIN AS MOORLAND OR WOODLAND. ONE SPECIAL FEATURE IS TOWER HILL,WHICH IS ABOUT 100m HIGH AND IS MADE OF VOLCANIC ROCK. ON ONE ROAD THE GRADIENT IS 1:3 AND IS EXTREMELY DIFFICULT FOR CARS.ON THE GREENOCK SIDE THE RAISED BEACH STRETCHES FURTHER INLAND AND IS COMPLETELY BUILT UP. THE LYLE HILL AFFORDS AN EXCELLENT VIEWPOINT OVER THE RIVER CLYDE TO THE ARGYLE HILLS WHICH MARK THE START OF THE SCOTTISH HIGHLANDS. THIS IS AN ESPECIALLY BEAUTIFUL SENIC AREA.
